result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Cannady, Craig D

records.addlTxt: Review hearing on December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

1:27 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Craig D Cannady in court, in custody. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. 
THE COURT ORDERS AN EVALUATION FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2) SUA SPONTE.  Court orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
Review hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on October 31, 2022
Initial appearance on November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Craig D Cannady
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-31-2022)
Prior: 5721 N 55th Pl, Milwaukee, WI 53218

3:15 PM Defendant Craig D Cannady not in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Court received notice from the jail that the defendant refused to come to Court today. The Court will adjourn the initial appearance to tomorrow. The Court will authorize the use of force in order for the defendant to be produced tomorrow.
Initial appearance scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
